image.altText: a woman sits at a kitchen table with a cup of tea reading a stack of documents

props.synopsis: Fran Ross has never made a home and contents insurance claim and says her property isn't at significant risk of natural disasters. The Brisbane pensioner's premiums are still going up by close to 400 per cent.

title.children: 'Absolutely extreme': Pensioner 'sick to my stomach' as home and contents insurance premiums quadruple

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein sit in grass with a golden retriever between them

props.synopsis: Most of the men mentioned in the unsealed documents have already been named in public as having met Jeffrey Epstein, and all deny knowing about his sex trafficking ring.

title.children: We read the Jeffrey Epstein documents so you don't have to. Here's what we found

image.altText: Three sculptures of green aliens with large black eyes in a museum

props.synopsis: What began as a craze in the 1940s became the subject of a secret US government program. Here's why politicians and scientists have started to take UFOs seriously.

title.children: 'Nothing has been the same since': Why is the US government taking UFOs so seriously?

image.altText: Alice Springs township as seen from Anzac Hill.

props.synopsis: Police call for information about a black Ford Ranger they say can help "find the perpetrators" after a dead body was found on a remote road near Alice Springs on Monday.

title.children: Police searching for 'perpetrators', seize vehicle in suspicious death of 19yo man near Alice Springs

image.altText: A slide of melioidosis bacteria being tested by a researcher

props.synopsis: Scientists discover a promising new class of antibiotic that targets one of the world’s most drug-resistant bacteria, but it's early days yet.

title.children: Scientists make promising breakthrough against superbug that attacks Australian ICU patients

image.altText: A Tesla parked next to a dark Volvo SUV near a green space.

props.synopsis: More Australians are making the transition to EVs as data reveals sales doubled last year, but experts say there's more that can be done to boost numbers even further.

title.children: EV sales doubled in Australia in the past year, but experts say there's 'a long way to go'

image.altText: A couple in the middle age standing in front of torn up carpet following floods.

props.synopsis: Flooding is becoming an all-too-familiar sight in Kerang, and climate reports are forecasting an extreme risk to the northern Victorian town by 2050.

title.children: While presents were being opened on Christmas Day, this town's residents fought off floodwaters

image.altText: A man sits in a caravan studying papers at his table

props.synopsis: When his Murray riverfront home was left uninhabitable by floodwaters 12 months ago, James Bailey took up an SA government offer to have it demolished, so he could rebuild it — but an issue with the title on the land has left him stuck.

title.children: James accepted a free offer to demolish his house after flooding — but found out he was on 'undocumented' land

image.altText: An elderly woman lies in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Raelene McEllister, 82, says she is afraid to return to her Alice Springs home after it was plundered on Boxing Day while she was in emergency surgery. She is among residents calling for further action on crime.

title.children: Thieves ransack house of elderly woman in surgery amid calls to tackle Alice Springs' 'out of control' summer crime rate

image.altText: A large crowd gathered around a casket with a man's face on it.

props.synopsis: Thousands of people attend the Beirut funeral of Hamas deputy leader Saleh al-Aruri, who was killed in a Lebanon strike that has been blamed on Israel.

title.children: Funeral for Hamas deputy held in Lebanon as Israel focuses assault on southern Gaza

image.altText: A man cries and hugs a child, another older man holds onto a crying man by the wrist.

props.synopsis: Islamic State claims responsibility for two explosions that killed at least 84 people and injured scores at a memorial for top commander Qassem Soleimani in Iran.

title.children: Islamic State claims responsibility for deadly attack in Iran, as Tehran vows revenge

image.altText: A broken escalator with rubbish.

props.synopsis: From derelict malls to aquariums and World War II bunkers, Nev Dennard's photographs tell the story of places we may have forgotten.

title.children: Photographer's 'apocalyptic' scenes of long-abandoned buildings spark nostalgia

image.altText: a male customer stands waiting at a pharmacy counter

props.synopsis: Since January 1, Victorians have no longer had access to any 24-hour pharmacies as cuts to government funding shrink the opening hours at local chemists.

title.children: On New Year's Day, Katie desperately needed a 24-hour pharmacy. But there are none left in Victoria

image.altText: An aerial photo of a destroyed plane on the ground

props.synopsis: A transcript of communication between air traffic control and two aircraft that collided and burst into flames at Tokyo’s Haneda Airport sheds some light on how the incident unfolded. Here's what it says.

title.children: Air traffic control transcript suggests only one plane had permission to be on runway before deadly Japan collision

image.altText: A man aims for a tennis ball with a racquet wearing a red shirt.

props.synopsis: Tennis great Rafael Nadal advances to the Brisbane International quarterfinals with another vintage display in his comeback tournament from hip surgery.

title.children: Nadal crushes Kubler to reach Brisbane International quarterfinals

image.altText: A young girl and a young boy pose for photo on a boat

props.synopsis: As their boat was swallowed by angry waves in the Gulf of Carpentaria this young family, with their four-month-old baby girl, needed a miracle. Their survival story became a local legend.

title.children: A capsized boat, baby and a violent storm, Karumba family reunites with man who helped them escape a watery grave

image.altText: In one half of the image, Bob Williams holds Oli the cat, the other is a sepia image of a ship's crewman with a cat

props.synopsis: Oli the cat may have been a novelty in this summer's Sydney-to-Hobart yacht race, but he's part of a long tradition of cats on boats.

title.children: Now a novelty, there was a time when cats were considered necessary at sea

image.altText: David Warner waves to the crowd and looks disappointed

props.synopsis: David Warner arrived at the SCG with designs on one final shining moment to cap a career, but on day two in Sydney that dream might have been taken away from him.

title.children: David Warner's grand farewell is not going to plan

image.altText: India players celebrate a wicket against South Africa.

props.synopsis: Not long after lunch on day two of the second Test, India wraps up a seven-wicket win over the Proteas, with only 642 legitimate deliveries bowled in the match.

title.children: India beats South Africa in shortest Test in cricket history

image.altText: Woman hands over Australian money to a man.

props.synopsis: Would you spend close to $30,000 for a chance to rub shoulders with those in charge of WA? Those with cash to splash have been doing just that — and many donations can remain hidden due to a legal loophole.

title.children: The millions in 'dark money' creating a 'stench' in WA politics

image.altText: arm of detective sifting through pile of wedding dresses on floor

props.synopsis: Queensland police say a 53-year-old Beaudesert woman defrauded customers by on-selling previous clients' wedding dresses in either their original form or by altering them for re-sale.

title.children: Queensland woman arrested over alleged wedding dress Ponzi scheme worth more than $100,000 and affecting 70 brides

image.altText: A large spider next to a 50 cent coin.

props.synopsis: With fangs that could pierce a human fingernail, the largest male specimen of the world's most venomous arachnid has found a new home at the Australian Reptile Park.

title.children: Lethal Sydney funnel-web spider 'Hercules' sets record for largest specimen collected in Australia

image.altText: red chicken eyeballs camera

props.synopsis: When a trailer of hens overturned on a NSW highway, it was up to the RFS and two animal lovers to rescue them, dodging B-double trucks and crawling through thick undergrowth.

title.children: 100 chickens stranded on motorway median strip couldn't cross the road — until the community came to their rescue

image.altText: A video still of a man jumping over a judge's bench in a US court

props.synopsis: Video shows a defendant in a felony battery case sparking a brawl inside a Las Vegas courtroom after leaping both the defence table and the judge's bench, to attack a district court judge.

title.children: US judge attacked by defendant in courtroom scene captured on video

image.altText: A woman with black hair in a white blazer speaks with her hands.

props.synopsis: The former 90210 actor has shared an update about her treatment journey after the cancer spread to her bones in November.

title.children: Actor Shannen Doherty hopes for 'three to five more years' after stage 4 cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A crowd of people run past a white vehicle.

props.synopsis: A video is circulating on social media that shows people shouting "call the police" in the aftermath of the incident.

title.children: Five injured after stray artillery shells hit town in south-west China near Myanmar

image.altText: A man draped in a Ukranian flag hugs a man in army fatigues among other released prisoners of war

props.synopsis: Russia's Defence Ministry says 248 military personnel were handed over by Ukraine and Kyiv said it had brought home 224 soldiers and six civilians in the largest documented swap of troops in the conflict so far.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange hundreds of prisoners of war

image.altText: Emergency workers next to the Cockle Train.

props.synopsis: An elderly pedestrian who was struck by a popular tourist train on the outskirts of Victor Harbor has died at the scene, with rail safety officers expected to attend the site.

title.children: Pedestrian fatally hit by Cockle Train on heritage railway line near Victor Harbor

image.altText: The lights on top of a police car in an Adelaide street.

props.synopsis: An internal investigation has been launched by SA Police after a photo of a partially naked woman in custody was uploaded to a police database.

title.children: SA Police investigate after mugshot of partially naked woman was uploaded to database

image.altText: black and white picture of man with barbed fence and prison cell behind

props.synopsis: Dean Williams was excited to be released from prison, but then he was filled with fear from the pressures of life on the outside.

title.children: In the days before his release from prison, Dean had a lot of questions swirling in his head
